ingredients: [{"ingredients":"325g can  sweetcorn"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp vegetable oil"},{"ingredients":"1 onion , roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp mild curry powder"},{"ingredients":"1 garlic clove , crushed"},{"ingredients":"1 x 50 sachet  creamed coconut , chopped"},{"ingredients":"4 frozen  smoked haddock fillets"},{"ingredients":"cooked rice , to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"In a blender, whizz the sweetcorn, along with any liquid from the can, into a rough purée and set aside."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a large lidded frying pan and cook the onion for 2-3 mins to soften. Add the curry powder and garlic and cook for 1 min more until fragrant."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Tip the creamed coconut into the pan with 300ml water, stirring until the creamed coconut dissolves. Add the puréed sweetcorn and bring to the boil. Place the haddock fillets in the sauce, then reduce the heat to a simmer. Cover and cook for 20 mins, or until the fish is cooked through. Season and serve with rice."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"2 leeks , thickly sliced"},{"ingredients":"2 garlic cloves , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"300g pearl barley, soaked for 1 hr"},{"ingredients":"4 carrots , cubed"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp Dijon mustard , plus extra to serve"},{"ingredients":"1l chicken stock"},{"ingredients":"300g Savoy cabbage , shredded"},{"ingredients":"200g lean  bacon joint, cooked, chopped into small pieces"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat a large pan over a medium heat. Add the olive oil and cook the leeks for a few mins, then add the garlic and cook for just 1 min more."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add the pearl barley, carrots and mustard, then pour over the chicken stock. Season with plenty of ground black pepper and simmer for 20 mins, stirring occasionally. Add the cabbage with the bacon, and cook for 5-10 mins until cabbage is wilted and tender. Serve with extra Dijon mustard on the side."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 tbsp vegetable or olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1 red onion, chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp cumin seeds"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp mustard seeds (any colour)"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp medium curry powder"},{"ingredients":"100g red or green lentil, or a mixture"},{"ingredients":"2 medium  sweet potatoes, peeled and cut into chunks"},{"ingredients":"500ml vegetable stock"},{"ingredients":"400g can chopped tomato"},{"ingredients":"400g can chickpea, drained"},{"ingredients":"¼ small pack coriander (optional)"},{"ingredients":"natural yogurt and naan bread, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat 2 tbsp vegetable or olive oil in a large pan, add 1 chopped red onion and cook for a few mins until softened."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add 1 tsp cumin seeds, 1 tsp mustard seeds and 1 tbsp medium curry powder and cook for 1 min more, then stir in 100g red or green lentils (or a mixture), 2 medium sweet potatoes, cut into chunks, 500ml vegetable stock and a 400g can chopped tomatoes."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Bring to the boil, then cover and simmer for 20 mins until the lentils and sweet potatoes are tender. Add a drained 400g can chickpeas, then heat through."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Season, sprinkle with ¼ small pack coriander, if you like, and serve with seasoned yogurt and naan bread."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"100g basmati rice"},{"ingredients":"200g green bean , topped and tailed, then halved"},{"ingredients":"1 ½ tbsp sunflower oil"},{"ingredients":"140g pork mince"},{"ingredients":"4 tsp dark soy sauce"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp rice wine"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"¼ tsp Sichuan pepper , lightly crushed using a pestle and mortar"},{"ingredients":"1 red chilli , halved and sliced"},{"ingredients":"4 fat garlic cloves , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 small knob of  ginger , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"3 spring onions , 2 finely chopped, 1 sliced for garnish"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp sesame oil"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Cook the rice following pack instructions. Boil the beans for 4 mins, then drain under cold water, pat dry and set aside."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"In a large non-stick wok or frying pan, heat 1 tbsp of the oil. Add the pork mince and fry for a few mins, breaking up into small pieces with the back of a spoon. Stir in half the soy, the rice wine and sugar and cook for 30 secs more. When the meat is cooked through, tip onto a plate."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Heat the remaining oil in the pan. Add the pepper, chilli, garlic, ginger and chopped onions, and stir-fry for 2 mins until ginger and garlic are softened. Tip in the beans, heat through, then add the mince – stir-fry for 2 mins until hot. Stir in the rest of the soy and sesame oil. Scatter with spring onions and serve with rice."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1-2 tbsp olive oil, plus extra if needed"},{"ingredients":"400g diced stewing beef"},{"ingredients":"1 onion, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 garlic cloves, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 ½ tsp ground cumin"},{"ingredients":"1-2 tbsp chipotle paste (or gluten-free alternative), depending on how spicy you like it"},{"ingredients":"400g can kidney bean in chilli sauce"},{"ingredients":"400g can chopped tomato"},{"ingredients":"1 lime, zested and cut into wedges"},{"ingredients":"¼ small pack coriander, leaves only"},{"ingredients":"cooked rice, to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a large pan and cook the beef pieces for a few mins on each side until browned all over. Remove from the pan with a slotted spoon and set aside."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add the onion to the pan, with extra oil if needed, and cook until softened. Stir in the garlic, cumin and chipotle paste, and cook for 1 min. Sieve the kidney beans, reserving the sauce. Add this sauce, along with the chopped tomatoes and a can full of water, to the pan. Stir well, then return the meat to the pan. Bring to a simmer, then cook, covered, for 2 hrs or until the beef is tender (or bake in the oven for 3 hrs at 160C/140C fan/gas 3)."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Add the reserved kidney beans and lime zest, season and warm through. Serve with a scattering of coriander leaves, the lime wedges to squeeze over, and rice, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 tsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1 onion , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 carrot , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 celery stick, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp vinegar (white, red or balsamic)"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp tomato purée"},{"ingredients":"400g can  chopped tomato or passata"},{"ingredients":"1l vegetable stock made with 2 cubes"},{"ingredients":"140g rice (long-grain, basmati, wild, brown or a mixture)"},{"ingredients":"¼ small pack  parsley , leaves only, chopped, and a few drops of pesto, to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a large saucepan and add the onion, carrot and celery, then cook gently until softened. Add the sugar and vinegar, cook for 1 min, then stir through the tomato purée. Add the chopped tomatoes or passata, the vegetable stock, and any brown rice, if using, then cover and simmer for 10 mins. If you are using wild rice, add this and simmer for 10 mins more. Finally, add any white rice you’re using, and simmer for a final 10 mins until the rice is tender."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Just before serving, sprinkle over some chopped parsley and season to taste. Divide into bowls and add a swirl of pesto to each, if you like."}]

recipe: Egg-fried cauliflower rice with prawn cracker crumbs
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"160g frozen green beans"},{"ingredients":"160g frozen peas"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp sunflower oil"},{"ingredients":"50g bacon lardons"},{"ingredients":"1 onion , chopped"},{"ingredients":"160g carrots , peeled and finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 large egg , beaten"},{"ingredients":"200g small cauliflower florets"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp soy sauce"},{"ingredients":"25ml sweet chilli sauce"},{"ingredients":"20g prawn cracker"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the kettle on to boil. Put the beans and peas in a large sieve then pour over the boiled water to defrost them. Drain and set aside."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat 1 tsp oil in a large, non-stick frying pan or wok. Add the bacon and fry for 2-3 mins. Add another 1 tsp oil and cook the onion and carrots for 1-2 mins until slightly softened, then push the veg and bacon to one side of the pan. Add the final 1 tsp oil, then pour in the egg, stirring constantly to scramble it."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Pulse the cauliflower in a food processor until it resembles rice. Add the cauliflower and soy to the pan, and stir together. Add the green beans and peas, and cook, stirring, for 1-2 mins until hot through. Divide between two plates and serve with sweet chilli sauce for drizzling. Break the prawn crackers into rough crumbs. The crackers absorb moisture quickly so, to keep them crunchy, it’s best to serve them in a dish on the side to sprinkle over the rice while eating."}]

recipe: Smoky sweet potato & bean cakes with citrus salad
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 sweet potato (about 200g), cut into cubes"},{"ingredients":"400g can red kidney beans , drained and rinsed"},{"ingredients":"3 spring onions , finely sliced"},{"ingredients":"small bunch of  coriander , chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp chipotle paste"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp sunflower oil"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp mayonnaise"},{"ingredients":"juice 1 lime"},{"ingredients":"1 Little Gem lettuce , torn"},{"ingredients":"½ cucumber , halved lengthways and sliced on the diagonal"},{"ingredients":"1 carrot , halved lengthways and sliced on the diagonal"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Microwave the sweet potato on High for 6 mins until tender. Lightly mash the beans, then add the potatoes, 2 spring onions, coriander, chipotle paste and seasoning. Mash a little more until the potato is combined. Shape into 4 cakes."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a non-stick frying pan, then fry the bean cakes for 4-5 mins each side."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Meanwhile, mix the mayo, lime juice and seasoning in a bowl. Add remaining onion and salad ingredients and toss well. Serve alongside the bean cakes."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"100g bulgur wheat"},{"ingredients":"6 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"100g couscous"},{"ingredients":"200g mixed shelled nut , roughly chopped (any mixture of almonds, hazelnuts, walnuts, pecans and pistachios)"},{"ingredients":"200g mixed  dried fruit , large fruit chopped (any mixture of raisins, sultanas, apricots, dates and cranberries)"},{"ingredients":"zest and juice 2  lemons"},{"ingredients":"small pack  mint , leaves roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"small pack  flat-leaf parsley , leaves roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 garlic cloves , crushed"},{"ingredients":"100g feta cheese , crumbled"},{"ingredients":"grilled lamb or  pork chops , to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Boil the kettle. Put the bulgur wheat in a sieve and rinse with cold water until the water runs clear. Drain well and transfer to a mixing bowl. Pour over 200ml boiling water and 1 tbsp olive oil, cover with a plate and leave to soak for 30 mins. Meanwhile, put the couscous into a second mixing bowl with 1 tbsp olive oil, just cover with boiling water, then cover with a plate and leave to stand for 5-10 mins."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Once the bulgur wheat and couscous are ready, put them in a mixing bowl and fluff up the grains with a fork. Stir through the nuts and dried fruit, too."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Whisk together the lemon zest and juice, herbs, remaining olive oil and the garlic. Pour over the grains, nuts and fruit, and stir everything together well with some seasoning. Transfer to a serving plate, scatter with the crumbled feta, and serve with grilled lamb or pork chops, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"200g vacuum-packed cooked beetroot (not in vinegar), cut into wedges"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"3 tsp sherry vinegar"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp clear honey"},{"ingredients":"2 eggs"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp crème fraîche"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp Dijon mustard"},{"ingredients":"a few stalks of  dill , most finely chopped, a few small fronds picked for garnish"},{"ingredients":"70g bag lamb's lettuce"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp roasted chopped hazelnut"},{"ingredients":"2 slices  bread and butter, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Pop the beetroot in a roasting tin, add half the oil, 2 tsp of the vinegar, the honey and seasoning. Roast for 20-25 mins, tossing twice until sticky. Leave to cool for a few mins."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Meanwhile, put the eggs in boiling water. Turn down the heat and simmer for 10 mins, then run under cold water to cool. Peel and halve."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Mix the remaining oil, crème fraîche, mustard, the final tsp of vinegar and chopped dill together. Toss the lamb’s lettuce in the dressing, and arrange on plates with the roasted beetroot and egg. Scatter with a few more dill fronds and tumble over the nuts. Serve with bread and butter."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 tbsp butter"},{"ingredients":"4 Granny Smiths apples, cored and diced"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp ground cinnamon"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp light brown sugar"},{"ingredients":"8 scoops vanilla ice cream"},{"ingredients":"2 ginger nuts biscuits, crushed"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"In a small saucepan, melt the butter over a gentle heat and add the apples, cinnamon and sugar. Cook for 10 mins or until the apples have softened but still hold their shape."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Split the mixture between four sundae glasses or bowls. Sit 2 scoops of ice cream on top of each, followed by the crushed biscuits. Serve while the apple mix is still warm."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 tbsp vegetable oil"},{"ingredients":"2 onions , thinly sliced"},{"ingredients":"1 garlic clove , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp mild  curry powder"},{"ingredients":"450g potato , coarsely grated and any excess liquid squeezed out"},{"ingredients":"6 medium eggs , beaten"},{"ingredients":"100g frozen pea"},{"ingredients":"small pack  coriander , roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"mango chutney, natural yogurt and naan bread , to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Heat the oil in an ovenproof frying pan and fry the onion for about 10 mins over a medium heat until golden. Add the garlic and curry powder and cook for 1-2 mins."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Next, add the grated potatoes and cook for 5-8 mins, stirring occasionally. You want the potatoes to soften, but also catch a little and turn golden in patches. Season the eggs, then pour into the pan with the peas and most of the coriander, swirling to coat the potato mixture. Cook for 1 min more, then transfer to the oven for 10 mins until the eggs have set. Sprinkle with the remaining coriander and serve with mango chutney, natural yogurt and naan bread, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 vegetable stock cube"},{"ingredients":"50ml teriyaki sauce"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp vegetable oil"},{"ingredients":"140g chestnut mushroom , sliced"},{"ingredients":"½ bunch spring onions , thinly sliced"},{"ingredients":"140g udon noodle"},{"ingredients":"200g bag spinach"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"In a large pan, dissolve the stock cube in 1 litre of water and stir in the teriyaki sauce. While the soup base comes to the boil, heat the oil in a frying pan and cook the mushrooms over a high heat, for 2-3 mins, until they turn golden. Add the spring onions and cook for 1 min more, then set aside."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Once the soup base has come to the boil, add the noodles and cook for 4 mins. Add the spinach and cook for 1 min more until just wilted. Stir in the mushrooms, spring onions and some seasoning, and serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"400g floury potatoes , such as King Edwards"},{"ingredients":"600g swede , peeled"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp chilli flakes"},{"ingredients":"100g '00' flour , plus extra for dusting"},{"ingredients":"30g parmesan (or vegetarian alternative), grated, plus extra to serve"},{"ingredients":"100g butter"},{"ingredients":"small pack sage  leaves picked"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 220C/200C fan/gas 7. Cut the potato and swede into equal- sized chunks, drizzle with 2 tbsp of the oil, season and roast for 50 mins or until completely soft. Leave to cool slightly, then pulse in a food processor until broken down. Add the chilli flakes, flour, Parmesan and some seasoning, then pulse again to form a sticky dough."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Bring a large pan of salted water to the boil in which to cook your gnocchi later. Flour your hands and divide the dough in three. On a floured surface, roll each portion into a sausage about 1cm in diameter. Using the back of a table knife, cut into pieces 2.5cm in length – this gives a tapered edge to the pieces of gnocchi."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Working in batches, cook the gnocchi in the water for 30 secs or until they rise to the surface. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on a tray lined with kitchen paper. Can be made to this stage up to 4 hrs ahead and kept in the fridge."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Turn the oven to its lowest setting and heat the remaining oil in a large frying pan over a medium heat. Fry the gnocchi in batches for 2 mins on each side until browned, then keep warm in the oven."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"Melt the butter in the pan, add the sage leaves and fry until crisp. Divide the gnocchi between bowls then spoon over the crisped sage and buttery sauce. Serve with pepper and grated Parmesan."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tbsp vegetable oil"},{"ingredients":"12 beef meatballs"},{"ingredients":"1 onion , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 garlic clove , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"294g can condensed mushroom soup"},{"ingredients":"½ x small pack dill , roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp mustard - French, wholegrain, or whatever you have in your cupboard"},{"ingredients":"mashed potato and cooked cabbage , to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a large lidded pan. Cook the meatballs for 3-4 mins over a medium heat, turning often so that they brown all over. Remove from the pan with a slotted spoon and drain away any excess oil, reserving about 1 tbsp."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add the onion and garlic to the pan and cook for 4-5 mins, stirring to soften. Stir in the soup with half a can of water. Return the meatballs to the pan and bring to the boil. Turn down the heat, cover and simmer for a further 10-15 mins until the meatballs are cooked through. Stir in the dill, mustard and some seasoning. Serve with mashed potato and cabbage."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"60g butter"},{"ingredients":"1 large onion, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 thyme sprigs, leaves picked"},{"ingredients":"250g pack chestnut mushrooms, sliced"},{"ingredients":"300g risotto rice"},{"ingredients":"1½l hot chicken stock"},{"ingredients":"200g cooked chicken, chopped into chunks"},{"ingredients":"50g grated parmesan, plus extra to serve (optional)"},{"ingredients":"small pack parsley, finely chopped"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the butter in a large pan over a gentle heat and add the onion. Cook for 10 mins until softened, then stir in the thyme leaves and mushrooms. Cook for 5 mins, sprinkle in the rice and stir to coat in the mixture."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Ladle in a quarter of the stock and continue cooking, stirring occasionally and topping up with more stock as it absorbs (you may not need all the stock)."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"When most of the stock has been absorbed and the rice is nearly cooked, add the chicken and stir to warm through. Season well and stir in the parmesan and parsley. Serve scattered with extra parmesan, if you like."}]

recipe: Jacket potato with whipped feta & sumac
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 baking potato"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"½ tsp garlic salt"},{"ingredients":"50g feta"},{"ingredients":"50g Greek yogurt"},{"ingredients":"1 roasted red peppers from a jar (about 25g), finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"½ tsp sumac"},{"ingredients":"few basil leaves , to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 220C/200C fan/ gas 6. Prick the potato all over with a fork and bake for 1 hr until it is golden outside and soft inside. Mix 1 tsp olive oil with the garlic salt. Cut a deep cross into the top of the jacket, drizzle the garlic oil into the cross and rub it all over the outside. Return to the oven and bake for 15 mins more until the edges are golden and crispy."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Meanwhile, crumble the feta into a bowl, add the yogurt and whisk together until creamy. Stir in the red pepper with a good grind of black pepper and spoon the whipped feta into the jacket. Sprinkle with the sumac, drizzle over the remaining 1 tsp olive oil and scatter a few torn basil leaves on top, if you like."}]

recipe: Macaroni cheese with bacon & pine nuts
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"50g pine nuts"},{"ingredients":"4 slices pancetta or bacon, chopped"},{"ingredients":"400g macaroni or other short pasta"},{"ingredients":"300ml pot double cream"},{"ingredients":"200ml pot crème fraîche"},{"ingredients":"200g gruyère or mature cheddar, grated"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp Dijon mustard"},{"ingredients":"green salad , to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Put the pine nuts in a dry frying pan, gently toast for 2-3 mins, then tip onto a plate. In the same pan, add the pancetta or bacon and cook for a few mins until crisp."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Bring a large pan of salted water to the boil and cook the pasta following pack instructions until al dente. Drain, reserving a ladleful of the pasta cooking water for later."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Meanwhile, put the double cream, crème fraîche and half the cheese in a saucepan, stir together and gently warm through until the cheese has melted. Take off the heat, stir in the mustard and some seasoning to taste."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Tip the drained pasta into a large baking dish and stir in the cheese sauce, adding some of the pasta cooking water if it looks a little dry. Sprinkle the toasted pine nuts and cooked pancetta over the top, then scatter over the remaining cheese. Bake for 20 mins until the top is golden and bubbling, then serve with a salad, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"4 good-quality  pork sausages"},{"ingredients":"2 courgettes , sliced on the diagonal then chopped into batons"},{"ingredients":"3 garlic cloves , finely sliced"},{"ingredients":"pinch of  chilli flakes"},{"ingredients":"400g can  chopped tomato"},{"ingredients":"200g rigatoni"},{"ingredients":"½ x 150g ball mozzarella , patted dry and torn into chunks"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a large frying pan. Squeeze the sausagemeat out of the skins, breaking it into little chunks, and pop in the pan. Fry for 8 mins until golden and cooked through. Tip in the courgettes, garlic and a pinch of chilli flakes. Fry for a few mins until just tender. Pour over the chopped tomatoes, season and bubble down for 5 mins or so, adding a splash of water if it’s looking too thick."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Meanwhile, cook the pasta following pack instructions. Drain and stir through the sauce and spoon everything into 2 small flameproof dishes."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Heat the grill to high. Dot the cheese on top of the sausage dishes, then place under the grill until the cheese is golden and bubbling (about 5-10 mins), and serve."}]

recipe: Egg-fried cauliflower rice with prawn cracker crumbs
name: Egg-fried cauliflower rice with prawn cracker crumbs

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"300g spaghetti"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1 onion , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 garlic cloves , crushed"},{"ingredients":"1 red chilli , deseeded and finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp tomato purée"},{"ingredients":"425g can  pilchard in tomato sauce"},{"ingredients":"70g pack dried  black olive with herbs (we used Crespo), roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"shaved parmesan , to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Cook the pasta following pack instructions. Heat the oil in a non-stick frying pan and cook the onion, garlic and chilli for 3-4 mins to soften. Stir in the tomato purée and cook for 1 min, then add the pilchards with their sauce. Cook, breaking up the fish with a wooden spoon, then add the olives and continue to cook for a few more mins."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Drain the pasta and add to the pan with 2-3 tbsp of the cooking water. Toss everything together well, then divide between plates and serve, scattered with Parmesan."}]

recipe: Jacket potato with whipped feta & sumac
name: Jacket potato with whipped feta & sumac

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"225 chorizo ring, sliced"},{"ingredients":"1 onion, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 garlic clove, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"300g pearl barley"},{"ingredients":"400g can chopped tomato with sliced olives"},{"ingredients":"1l hot chicken stock, made with 1 stock cube"},{"ingredients":"2 stalks rosemary, leaves chopped"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat a non-stick frying pan over a medium heat and fry the chorizo for 3-4 mins until it turns golden and releases its oil. Remove with a slotted spoon and set aside."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add the onion and garlic to the pan, and cook for 3-4 mins, until they begin to soften. Add the pearl barley and stir well to coat in the oil, before tipping in the chopped tomatoes and the chicken stock. Bring just to the boil, then turn down to a simmer and cook for 30 mins, stirring occasionally, until all the liquid has been absorbed and the pearl barley is tender. You may need to top up with a little extra water as you go."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Season and stir in the rosemary and chorizo to serve."}]

recipe: Smoky sweet potato & bean cakes with citrus salad
name: Smoky sweet potato & bean cakes with citrus salad

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"400g spaghetti"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"120g smoked streaky bacon, sliced into matchsticks"},{"ingredients":"1 onion, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 garlic clove, finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp sweet smoked paprika"},{"ingredients":"2 x 400g cans chopped tomatoes"},{"ingredients":"grated parmesan, to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Bring a large pan of water to the boil and cook the spaghetti following pack instructions. Meanwhile, heat the oil in a large non-stick frying pan and cook the bacon for 3-4 mins until just starting to crisp. Stir in the onion and cook for another 3-4 mins, then add the garlic and smoked paprika, and cook for 1 min more."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Pour in the chopped tomatoes, bring to the boil and bubble for about 5 mins until thickened, stirring every so often to stop it catching on the bottom. Drain the pasta and toss with the sauce. Serve with Parmesan, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"60g unsalted butter"},{"ingredients":"6 skinless boneless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces"},{"ingredients":"80g smoked pancetta, cut into small pieces"},{"ingredients":"2 large onions, sliced"},{"ingredients":"40g plain flour"},{"ingredients":"500ml chicken stock"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp finely chopped tarragon"},{"ingredients":"2-3 tbsp wholegrain mustard"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp double cream"},{"ingredients":"2 x 450g packs fresh prepared mashed potato"},{"ingredients":"drizzle of olive oil"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Melt 20g of the butter in a flameproof casserole dish over a medium heat. Season the chicken and add to the dish with the pancetta. Fry for 5 mins until the pancetta is crispy and the chicken browned and cooked through. Set aside in a bowl."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Lower the heat, add the remaining butter and, when it starts foaming, add the onions. Cook for 10 mins until softened, then stir through the flour and cook for another 2 mins. Remove from the heat and slowly whisk in the chicken stock. Return to the hob, bring to the boil and cook for 5 mins. Stir through the tarragon, mustard and cream, followed by the chicken and pancetta, and cook for another 5 mins until the sauce is thickened."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Heat the grill to high. Heat the mashed potato following pack instructions, then spoon on top of the chicken filling in the casserole dish. Smooth and swirl the potato over right to the edges, drizzle with a little olive oil and put under the grill for 8-10 mins or until the top is golden and bubbling."}]

recipe: Macaroni cheese with bacon & pine nuts
name: Macaroni cheese with bacon & pine nuts

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"700g Maris Piper potatoes , cut into medium chunks"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp vegetable oil"},{"ingredients":"4 rashers streaky bacon , cut into bite-sized pieces"},{"ingredients":"40g unsalted butter"},{"ingredients":"½ tbsp jerk seasoning"},{"ingredients":"200g prepared pineapple chunks"},{"ingredients":"4 large eggs"},{"ingredients":"½ small pack coriander , torn"},{"ingredients":"½ red chilli , thinly sliced"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Bring a large pan of lightly salted water to the boil. Add the potatoes and boil for 7 mins, then drain and leave to steam-dry for 5 mins. Meanwhile, heat the oil in a large frying pan over a medium heat and fry the bacon for 5 mins until crispy."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add the butter to the pan along with the potatoes and seasoning, and fry over a medium heat, turning occasionally, for 12 mins. Nestle the pineapple chunks in the pan and cook for a further 3 mins."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Crack the eggs over the potatoes, cover the pan with a lid or large plate and cook for 5-6 mins over a medium-low heat until the whites are just set and the yolks are still runny. Finish with the coriander and a sprinkle of chilli."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"600g baby aubergines, sliced into rounds"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"2 onions, finely sliced"},{"ingredients":"2 garlic cloves, crushed"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp garam masala"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp turmeric"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp ground coriander"},{"ingredients":"400ml can chopped tomatoes"},{"ingredients":"400ml can coconut milk"},{"ingredients":"pinch of  sugar (optional)"},{"ingredients":"½ small pack coriander, roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"rice or chapatis, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Toss the aubergines in a roasting tin with 2 tbsp olive oil, season well and spread out. Roast for 20 mins or until dark golden and soft."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat the remaining oil in an ovenproof pan or flameproof casserole dish and cook the onions over a medium heat for 5-6 mins until softening. Stir in the garlic and spices, for a few mins until the spices release their aromas."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Tip in the tomatoes, coconut milk and roasted aubergines, and bring to a gentle simmer. Simmer for 20-25 mins, removing the lid for the final 5 mins to thicken the sauce. Add a little seasoning if you like, and a pinch of sugar if it needs it. Stir through most of the coriander. Serve over rice or with chapatis, scattering with the remaining coriander."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tbsp Cajun seasoning"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp vegetable oil"},{"ingredients":"zest and juice 1  lime"},{"ingredients":"750g large  potato , cut into chips"},{"ingredients":"1kg chicken wing"},{"ingredients":"green salad or coleslaw and  ketchup , to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. In a bowl, whisk together the Cajun seasoning, vegetable oil, lime zest and juice. Toss the chips, wings and Cajun mixture together in batches, so that everything is well coated."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Cover a large baking sheet with foil, then arrange the chips around the outside and the wings in the middle. Season and bake for 20 mins, then turn the chips and return to the oven for a further 20-25 mins until the chips and wings are golden. Serve with green salad, or coleslaw and ketchup."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"400g can cannellini beans , drained and rinsed"},{"ingredients":"1 small lemon , zested and juiced"},{"ingredients":"small garlic clove , grated"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp roughly chopped parsley"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1 skinless haddock fillet"},{"ingredients":"2 artichokes from a can, drained and halved"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. In a bowl, mix the beans, zest and juice of half the lemon, the garlic and parsley. Stir through 1 tbsp olive oil and season to taste. Very lightly crush the beans with the back of a wooden spoon, keeping some of them whole."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Cut a large square of baking parchment, spoon the beans onto the centre and top with the fish. Scatter the artichokes around the fish, drizzle over the remaining olive oil, squeeze a little lemon juice over and season well. Bring both sides of the parchment upwards and fold together to create a tight seal, then twist the ends tightly (like a giant sweet)."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Put the fish on a baking tray and bake in the oven for 13-15 mins or until the fish is just cooked."}]
